definition:
A *strictly* is an upper triangular matrix which has $0$ on the main
diagonal. Similarly a *strictly lower triangular matrix* is a lower
triangular matrix which has $0$ on the main diagonal. i.e.

A strictly upper triangular matrix is of the form

$$\begin{bmatrix}
0 & a_{12} & a_{13} & \cdots & a_{1n} \\
0 & 0 & a_{23} & \cdots & a_{2n} \\
0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & a_{3n} \\
\vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0
\end{bmatrix}$$

A strictly lower triangular matrix is of the form

$$\begin{bmatrix}
0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
a_{21} & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
a_{31} & a_{32} & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
\vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
a_{n1} & a_{n2} & a_{n3} & \cdots & 0
\end{bmatrix}$$
